page.title: 01 THE AREA SOUTH OF WINGRAVE
page.content: Wingrave is a village out in the countryside. There are a few villages close by.One village is Rowsham which is very small and has a main road running through it.There are no shops or recreation ground so some of the children come to Wingrave to play. There is a farm named Bailey's farm. They don't grow crops and all their land is grass land. A bit farther away is Hulcott which is a small village as well.It has a old nursing home which looks after old people.The only churches around our area are in Wingrave and Hulcott.The church in Hulcott is 250yrs old.The Wingrave church was built in Norman times.
